s.text: But I firmly posit that the increasingly free flow of information that the Internet allows can only benefit people in the long run by educating them on the wider world outside their windows.
But I firmly posit that the increasingly free flow of information that the Internet allows can only benefit people in the long run by educating them on the wider world outside their windows.
But I firmly posit that the increasingly free flow of information that the Internet allows can only benefit people in the long run by educating them on the wider world outside their windows.
In any case, you hit all the high points of the arguments pro and con that are taking place, so let me address them one by one.
I am troubled by the kind of behavior that the Internet seems to engender and am often offended by the cruel and mindless blather that is too easy to find.
Frankly, I would rather be able to more clearly see exactly what these sites are spouting than to have them hide away dangerously in dark corners, ready to pounce.
